# allowsExtensionItems

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar can add items for Action extensions.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var allowsExtensionItems: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the toolbar can dynamically create toolbar items for Action extensions in the toolbar configuration panel. The toolbar can only add an Action extension if its `Info.plist` file contains the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSExtension/NSExtensionAttributes/NSExtensionServiceAllowsToolbarItem] key with the value [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Configuring the toolbar’s behavior

- **isVisible**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar is visible.
- **displayMode**: A value that indicates whether the toolbar displays items using a name, icon, or combination of elements.
- **NSToolbar.DisplayMode**: Constants that indicate whether the toolbar displays items using a name, icon, or combination of elements.
- **showsBaselineSeparator**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the toolbar shows the separator between the toolbar and the main window contents.
- **allowsUserCustomization**: A Boolean value that indicates whether users can modify the contents of the toolbar.
